By understanding your clients’ needs, you should be converting your prospects into customers and are building a strong sales pipeline.

\xa0

Responsibilities

  • Acquires and develops new accounts with the clear focus to generate revenue streams across all products and services in both the local market, as well as across the entire Compass Offices network
  • Grows business from existing customers (through referrals) to drive expansions and new sales into other territories
  • Further improve the occupancy and profitability by driving high conversion of all products through effectively following the sales process
  • Develops a high level of territory knowledge within all the following areas: competition, industry segments, market segments, target companies
  • Inputs all appropriate information into the database
  • Preparing quotes and proposals

\xa0

  • Capable in excel under pressure with persistence and being self-disciplined\xa0\xa0
  • Strong presenter, planner, time manager and aggressive producer with the ability to set priorities and maintain high-quality standards
  • Genuine and capable social butterfly who enjoys building up a professional network
  • Excellent verbal/written communication skills in English

\xa0

Marketing Director(Location: Tianjin, China)

Company Name Tiens Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 60 minutes ago Number of views 2 views

Job description

工作地点：中国天津

Location: Tianjin, China

\xa0

岗位职责Responsibility:

根据公司业务战略和经营计划，结合品牌战略，制定全球产品战略并在区域范围内组织实施.

Define regional product strategy and implement it globally based on company’s business strategy, operation plan and brand strategy.

\xa0

1. \xa0 \xa0 产品规划及生命周期管理：组织完成全球产品战略的规划（含产品线的策划），经审批后，推动实施；监控产品管理制度和日常审批流程体系的顺利运作；批准新品开发上市；批准并组织实施老品退市、产品升级；管理各产品线的生命周期，包括跟进各产品在区域的销售情况，完成销售分析，为产品管理决策提供依据。

Product planning and product lifespan management:\xa0

\xa01.1 lead to define and implement global product strategy (including product line);\xa0

1.2 Monitor product management regulations and daily examination and approval procedures to make sure all the procedure run smoothly;\xa0

1.3 manage new product development and launching;

\xa01.4 organize and conduct product upgrading and discontinuing;\xa0

1.5 manage lifespan of all product lines, including following up with sales status of products in different regions and analyzing sales figures to provide reference for product management decisions.

2. \xa0 \xa0 产品定价和价格调整：按照市场价格需求，与区域市场部门、集团总部的财务部门一道，把控产品毛利底线，协调相同单品在不同国家的定价; 对区域导入品的定价，提出政策要求或指导意见\xa0

Product pricing and price adjusting:\xa0

\xa02.1 coordinate with finance and marketing departments to control the gross margin of each SKU in different regions;\xa0

\xa02.2 ODM and OEM product management in regions.

3. \xa0 \xa0 产品推广：审核整合后的产品故事、卖点、功效等内容，给予适当、准确的产品定位；审核产品推广方案（包括配套的产品文宣资料），督促执行；跟进产品的推广效果，持续改进产品推广流程。

Product promoting:

\xa03.1 define product positioning by integrating product stories, unique selling proposition, function, etc.;\xa0

3.2 plan and manage the product promotion in the regions, manage and monitor each product launching plans (including the promotion materials); 3.3 oversee and improve the product promotion process

\xa0

任职资格Requirements：

1. \xa0 \xa0 本科学历，具有海外学习背景\xa0

Possess a bachelor degree or above;oversea study experience will be a plus;

2. \xa0 \xa0 15年以上大型跨国企业相关工作经验（快消品、保健品或化妆品行业，安利、康宝莱、宝洁、玫琳凯、雅芳），有2年以上直销行业工作经验更佳\xa0

At least 15 years’ experience in product management of multinational companies (consumer goods, healthcare and wellness or beauty industry, preferable experience in Amway, Herbalife, P&G, MaryKey, Avon) , and at least 2 years’ experience in large direct selling (Multi-level marketing) enterprise;

3. \xa0 \xa0 能熟练用英语做工作语言；持国外护照，方便国际出差旅行\xa0

Excellent in both written and oral communication skills in English

4. \xa0 \xa0 熟悉保健品、化妆品行业产品标准，具备丰富的新产品市场推广知识；在直销国际化营销,策略规划.项目领导,中国保健食品注册,人才管理等方面有专长；

Familiar with dietary supplements and cosmetics industry standards；expertise in mark promotion of new product;expertise in global marketing,strategicplaning, project management, healthcare and wellness product registration and human resource management.

5. \xa0 \xa0 具有国际市场.海外协调工作经验，熟悉国内外保健食品.保健用品.食品.药品.化妆品,日化用品行业市场，有产品管理.产品培训及产品分析相关专业知识；

have experience in international marketing development and promotion

带领团队进行产品开发，并具有灵活机敏的危机处理意识；

be able to do product R&D with a team, and handle emergency and crisis.

Application Architect_SAP Basis - 1 year Fixed Term Hire - Melbourne

Company Name IBM Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 17 hours ago Number of views 10 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Description

Application Architect_SAP Basis - 1 year Fixed Term Hire - Melbourne

IBM is the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, serving clients in 170 countries. In this new era of Cognitive Business, IBM is helping to reshape industries by bringing together our expertise in Cloud, Analytics, Security, Mobile, and the Internet of Things. We are changing how we create. How we collaborate. How we analyse. How we engage. IBM is a leader in this global transformation so there is no better place to launch your career.

IBM Global Business Services (GBS) is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM GBS empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge. We outthink ordinary. Discover what you can do at IBM. We are hiring.

We are currently recruiting SAP Delivery Analyst, SAP Application Architect for a 12 months fixed term contract, based in Melbourne.
The SAP Delivery Analyst’s responsibilities include –
  • Monitoring, analysing, tuning and optimising the business processes in close co-operation with the Business Process Specialists
  • Support the Application Service Delivery Manager with interfacing to all Customer Business Representatives for current and future functional changes
  • Involvement in all urgent Application / Interface issues irrespective of the technology, change requests and triage
  • Assist and backup for Application Service Delivery Manager
  • Supporting the offshore delivery team in the resolution of incidents and problems related to all the SAP applications including SAP interfaces.
  • Escalation point in and out of hours as per contracted support hours
  • Technical review of changes and implementation plans
  • Technically advise new directions for the system
  • Work with Supplier support management structure in IT Application Support Services and Infrastructure service provider to ensure customer delivery
  • Ensure system performance and capacity is being met
  • Responsible for managing the offshore SAP Basis, SAP PI streams
To ensure success in the role you will possess the following skills –
  • SAP Basis and SAP PI experience in an SAP Implementation and Support projects.
  • Extensive Knowledge of RDBMS (Oracle, DB2, MS SQL Server 2012, SAP ASE/SQL Anywhere and HANA).
  • Extension knowledge in scripting languages like Shell, Batch, WSScript, WinAuto
  • Expertise in Web Development using HTML, CSS, Javascript
  • Extensive experience with analysis, maintenance, customization and installation of SAP applications
  • Must be extremely good and knowledgeable in understanding various SAP interfaces with 3rd party systems
  • Very good knowledge in OS like AIX, Suse Linux, Windows platforms etc.,
  • Must be Certified in SAP HANA
  • Strong written and verbal communications
  • Experience in mobile development (iOS or Android) a nice-to-have
Compensation package from $85 400 (full-time equivalent) and will be determined based on successful candidates relevant skills and experience.

If you tick these boxes, and are ready to start your next challenge with a career at IBM – click “Apply” today. To find out more, head to www.ibm.com.au/careers

884731556:
[

Technical Lead - Data Platform

Company Name REA Group Company Location Richmond, Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 20 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


We're reimagining the way we use data in REA and we'd love you to come help us.



About the role
The Data Services tribe is looking for a Technical Lead to join us and help build the systems and applications that will help drive REA forward on its mission to 'change the way the world experiences property'. At the heart of the Data Services tribe is the Data Platform - the set of systems and components that will allow the wider business to get the most out of our consumer and customer data. The Data Services Tribe supports and develops data flows, data storage and property data insights which underpin REA's revenue and product growth. This role will help REA build out a Data Platform to allow REA's customers to access campaign and market data and allow REA to build personalized consumer experiences.



You will form a part of the leadership team for your area and while the focus of this role is on architecture and leadership, you will remain hands on and work with teams to develop software solutions using agile software development practices as required. You will champion our technical practices to ensure a high-quality outcome for our business. You will share responsibility for the provisioning, deployment and operational support of the software your team builds.



What you will learn:

  • A variety of backend data development tech - we love Scala, Functional Programming and Spark for our new APIs. Depending on the system, we also use Ruby, AWS, Zeppelin/Jupyter notebooks, and anything else that fits the job.
  • Scala & Ruby - most of our existing systems are written in Ruby, but we're developing many of our new products in Scala. If Scala or Ruby are new to you, that's fine provided you've got experience in another OO language and have the desire to learn new languages.
  • Google BigQuery - our standard for how we publish data internally for analysts, data scientists and data enthusiasts within REA.
  • DevOps - all our developers create, support, and monitor infrastructure using Amazon Web Services. All our apps are tested and deployed using Docker. There's loads of internal support so don't be afraid if this is new.
  • Agile - REA is renowned for its agile approach. Teams are given the autonomy to come up with solutions independently in cross-functional teams.




What we expect:

  • Someone with a few runs on the board - ideally with 10+ years of experience working in software development and 3+ working in data engineering
  • Someone passionate about data and the latest data technology
  • Experience advanced data solutions on top of Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services technology
  • Experience building AI and Machine Learning Pipelines
  • Able to communicate and collaborate effectively with business stakeholders.
  • Able to contribute to technology leadership teams within a business unit.
  • Able to lead multiple engineering teams in a collaborative agile team environment.
  • Looks at tricky situations through a solutions-focused lens
  • Work productively in a fast paced and agile environment.




What is it like to work with us in Data Services?
Each team in Data Services has around 8-10 people who work together across technology, product and delivery as an autonomous unit. We believe strongly in pairing, testing and continuous delivery, mixed with large doses of fun. We support funded training and personal development, and because we're involved with almost every LOB in the business, there's flexibility to develop one or more specialisms.



Each week we participate in guilds across the company to keep our skills sharp and increase our impact, and in team retrospectives where we keep track of how our team is going. Your manager acts as a mentor to help guide you and your career, instead of being someone who monitors your day to day.



We're committed to creating inclusive, safe environments where anyone, no matter their background, can contribute and succeed.



What you get beyond a great remuneration package?

  • Birthday leave. A day off for your birthday.
  • Flexible working arrangements. We've got people who work part time, and people who work from home one day a week.
  • 3 days every 4 months in our regular hackathon - See: http://hackday.realestate.com.au
  • Industry-leading parental leave system.
  • Onsite health and wellbeing programs, including yoga and meditation classes along with showers and clean towels for when you work up a sweat.




About REA Group
Our leading brand is Australia's biggest property resource, realestate.com.au. We also operate the number one commercial property site, realcommercial.com.au, and have businesses that help property developers and other brands advertise with us. Whilst we live in Australia, we've also got ventures in Asia and North America, and have the vision of expanding our footprint further. Everything we do is driven by our purpose to 'change the way the world experiences property' - from product innovation to our international investments.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Media Production

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Information Technology
]

884756543:
[

Marketing & Communications Officer

Company Name UCA Funds Management Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 3 hours ago Number of views 10 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About us

UCA Funds Management\xa0is an independent ethical investment manager providing multi-asset class products and solutions to wholesale and retail investors. We commenced business in 1985 and are proud of our long history as a social enterprise actively supporting community development and social justice.


About the role

We are entering a phase of significant growth and are seeking talented professionals to join our team. That’s where you come in! \xa0As the Marketing and Communications Officer, you will play a key role in supporting the business through the creation of targeted marketing and communications.\xa0You will serve as a brand advocate in the organisation, supporting staff at all levels with brand education and support.


The Marketing and Communications Officer will be responsible for day-to-day branding, marketing and communications activities and support across the business, including:

  • Integrated campaign development and execution
  • Content development, editing and proofing
  • Desktop publishing and design support


This will be an initial part-time 6 month contract, with the possibility of extension.


About you

You are a highly motivated and proactive individual who enjoys working as part of a team as well as autonomously. You have a positive work attitude and are values-driven.


You have excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to communicate with stakeholders at all levels of the business. You are highly organised, results focused (quality over quantity) and have a keen eye for detail. You love generating new ideas and are able to translate complex information into simple, engaging content.


To secure this role you will have:

  • 3+ years of proven experience in a marketing and communications role, with financial industry experience an advantage
  • Experience in content development, editing and proofing
  • Solid desktop publishing and/or graphic design experience
  • Tertiary qualification in marketing, communications or similar field
  • Expertise using Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator)

\xa0

Applications close:\xa010 October 2018

TO APPLY: Please submit a covering letter addressing the key selection criteria.

Applications from recruitment agencies will not be accepted.


Our culture

Governed by an independent board of finance industry and other professionals, UCAFM is an independent institution of the Uniting Church in Australia Synod of Victoria and Tasmania and so works within the ethos of the church.

884144135:
[

Big Data and Machine Learning Engineer

Company Name nbn™ Australia Company Location Docklands, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 159 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


As nbn is moving to the Scale phase, in parallel, the telecom industry is going through transformation driven by Network-IT convergence, Virtualisation, Analytics and Machine Learning. In order to keep pace, the nbn Systems / Applications architecture require step change (transformation) that is business driven, agile and scalable.




The Big Data & Machine Learning Engineer is part of a small team of senior technology researchers, engineers and data scientists pushing the envelope of what is possible with analytics at nbn. They are a key contributor to the research, design, development and operationalisation of our data science platforms and models - including software prototyping and evaluation, data engineering to support data science investigations, and the operationalisation of machine learning models. As a technical practitioner, this engineer leverages their expertise in small-team DevOps and relevant experience in big data and ML technologies to build and support full-stack solutions in a heterogeneous polyglot environment.




A bit about your role




Outlined below are the core duties that the Big Data and Machine Learning Engineer will be responsible for delivering:



  • Provide data engineering support for data science research activities, build and harden data pipelines for ingestion of high quality data and drive operationalisation of machine learning models.
  • Work with business teams to iterate and refine visualisations of analytical outcomes.
  • Apply DevOps, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery principles to build automated pipelines for deployment.
  • Research, propose and prototype the application of big data technologies, and document outcomes.
  • Collaborate with senior architects and engineers to define the architecture and technology selection.
  • Provide both technical and operational leadership with direct accountability for implementation of technology.
  • Share knowledge with immediate peers and build communities and connections that promote better technical practices across the organisation.




A bit about you




The ideal candidate for this role is a fast learner and confident self-starter; naturally curious and passionate about technology, but also an excellent communicator who yearns to work with a small group of senior practitioners. At their core is a collaborative attitude, open mindset, balanced opinions, big picture perspective, technical proficiency and commitment to getting the job done with the team.




You will have likely worked in a number of application development projects for a large, commercial organisation; participating in the development of requirements, use of source control, application design and software verification.




With a strong technical proficiency, you will demonstrate experience with languages such as Python, R, Scala, Go and Javascript and have worked with NoSQL databases including HBase, Cassandra, Elastic, MongoDB and MapR. Furthermore, it will be essential to have experience with Relational Databases, Data Modelling and ETL/ELT design and Data Profiling.




Life at nbn




At nbn you'll be joining a team that believes there is strength in diversity and opportunity through inclusion. We're building an inclusive and diverse workplace where different perspectives, thinking and skills are valued and people are supported to achieve their potential. We're committed to our goal of increasing the presence of women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples in the business and have a focus on increasing diversity amongst our leadership teams.




Continue the conversation




If you think this role might be for you, we want to hear from you. Please apply by following the links and sending in your resume only. We do not require a cover letter or any selection criteria to be addressed.




nbn is a fast moving organisation with lots to deliver - so we may not always wait until the job ad expires before reviewing applications. As a result, you should submit your application as soon as possible!




At nbn our people and our planet matter. We have an unwavering commitment to the wellbeing and safety of our employees so that everyone goes home safely each day and can perform at their peak to deliver the nbn network. nbn also aims to build a network that minimises energy use and can be operated with minimal impact on the environment.

The Organisation
Sharp & Carter is proud to be working exclusively with one of Asia's largest agri-businesses; listed on the Singaporean Stock Exchange, it is ranked as one of the largest by way of market-capitalisation. Here in Australia, the organisation has a number of business interests in the agricultural space focusing on the production, manufacture, transportation and sale of raw products both in Australia and internationally.
Sharp & Carter has been exclusively engaged by this international organisation in their search for a Financial Accountant to join their high performing finance team based in the western fringes of the CBD.

The Role

Duties

As such, your duties will include, but not be limited to

Reporting directly to the Finance Manager, the primary purpose of your role will be to ensure the proper stewardship of financial transactions of Sugar Australia by delivering accurate and complete financial information.
  • Management of financial reporting requirements, reconciliations and variance explanations for end of month, quarter end, half year, and end of year reporting including fixed assets, overhead expenses, accounts receivable, and capital accounting.

Billing Analyst

Company Name Transurban Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 1 hour ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • 727 Collins St, VIC
  • Fixed-term, Full-time
  • 12 months

Customers and local communities are at the heart of our business and we continually strive to improve the way we service and support them. With a vast and evolving network of roads, and a growing customer base, fairly and accurately charging customers the correct amount for fees is of utmost importance to us. As our Billing Charges Assurance Analyst, you’ll take great pride in ensuring all customers are being charged the correct amounts for non-trip related fees across all Transurban retail brands.

Sitting in our Customer team, you’ll be part of a department that puts people first. We never stop exploring new ways to make life better, inside Transurban and out. Neither will you. Collaboration and development are top of our agenda- we want you to make an impact that extends far beyond the job you excel at. That’s why we’ll encourage you to share your ideas as we help you pursue the career you want.

The impact you’ll have
  • You will develop and then manage the ongoing operations of a controls framework to help us determine how fees should be charged, getting the best and fairest result for the customer.
  • You’ll be the custodian and developer of high level dashboard reporting, providing analysis, commentary and recommendations where required.
  • You’ll play a crucial role in supporting a reduction of revenue leakage, using your analysis and insights to drive P&L improvements, always looking for better ways to do things and searching for different angles to attack problems from.
  • You’ll build a deep understanding of our billing platform, identifying issues and liaising with a host of stakeholders to ensure errors and incidents are managed and rectified efficiently.
  • First and foremost you’ll be a data person, providing day to day support to our reporting and analytics environment through custodianship, administration and validation activities.

The talents you’ll bring
  • As a data guru, you’ll bring well-developed documentation and modelling skills, with technical proficiency across Lavastorm (advantageous) and SQL (a must).
  • Our ideal candidate will likely bring significant experience gained in a big billing environment, with some form of assurance experience viewed favourably.
  • You’ll bring high level data manipulation, analysis and reporting capability, including defined success developing new and improved reporting practices
  • Analytical and incisive, you’ll spot issues and use your own ingenuity – and that of your team – to solve problems collaboratively.
  • You’ll possess high levels of attention to detail, with the accuracy of the information you compile and send out essential to your success.
  • You’ll enjoy researching and investigating, share a willingness to learn and won’t be frightened by tight deadlines and a dynamic, high pressure environment.


About Us

Transurban is driven by bringing people and places closer. The roads we plan, build, operate and maintain make communities stronger, across Australia and beyond. Together, we’re building a future that marries traditional infrastructure with emerging technology. We’re making roads ready for driverless cars and predicting accidents before they happen. We’re getting people where they’re going. And we’re doing it faster, smarter and safer, every last one of us.

Start changing the world around you. Apply now!

About Us

The Transport Accident Commission (TAC) is a Victorian Government-owned organisation. The role of the TAC is to promote road safety through the Towards Zero road deaths and serious injuries strategy, improve the State's trauma system and support those who have been injured on our roads.

TAC Benefits

We offer a range of exciting benefits, including:

  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Health and wellbeing services, including onsite doctor, flu vaccinations, fresh fruit and subsidised gym memberships
  • Access to our annual bonus scheme and rewards and recognition programme
  • Social club membership
  • Employee referral and study assistance programmes
  • Salary packaging options, including extra super contributions and novated leasing
  • Recognition of prior service in the public sector for the purposes of LSL

About the Role

In this role, you will assess the business and information needs of the organisation and coordinate the design of new Business Intelligence solutions to improve business efficiency and productivity.

Key accountabilities include:

  • Analysing business\technical requirements and objectives and develop Business Intelligence requirements
  • Preparing artefacts for the purpose of BI development and testing
  • Maintaining continuity of design across all TAC BI solutions

About You

To be successful in this role, you will ideally possess the following skills and attributes:

  • A degree or post-graduate qualification in business or other relevant tertiary qualifications
  • Business analysis and information presentation
  • Preparation and presentation of corporate documentation
  • The ability to interpret complex information and develop viable recommendations
  • An understanding of Business Intelligence technologies such as SAS E-Guide & SAS VA

Our Values

  • We value life
  • We make every conversation count
  • We will find a better way, today
  • We make the complicated simple

Diversity and Inclusion

The TAC promotes a workplace that actively seeks to include, welcome and value unique contributions of all people and is committed to diversity and social inclusion in its employment practices. As Victoria’s Commission for transport accident treatment and services, we strongly encourage people with a disability to apply for our roles. People from indigenous, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds are also encouraged to apply.

How to Apply

Job description

  • Contract position until June 2019
  • Located in Albert Road, South Melbourne
  • Join us and thrive!

Australian Unity is a national health, wealth and living mutual company providing products and services designed to help people thrive. More than one million Australians have created a brighter future with us. We are a mutual organisation with 280,000 members, more than 7000 employees and generating more than $2 billion in revenues per annum.

Your Role

An exciting opportunity has become available within the Transformation Office for a Business Analyst.

Reporting directly to the Delivery Lead – Transformation Office, you will initially be assigned to transformational ways of working initiatives with responsibility for current state process analysis and trend analysis of Human Resources data. You will be required to work across a number of initiatives with a primary focus on supporting the delivery of transformational initiatives across a variety of domains.

You will be responsible for all aspects of the current state analysis, initiative requirements gathering, the writing of business and functional requirements, business process mapping, documenting operational models and supporting all aspects of testing. In addition, you will facilitate workshops and ensure that business requirements are met.

To be successful in securing this role you will have:

  • Extensive relevant BA experience gained in a medium to large organisation
  • A working knowledge of relevant waterfall delivery principles with exposure to Agile techniques being highly advantageous
  • Proven experience working on HR projects and initiatives
  • Demonstrated track record of delivering high quality business requirement documentation
  • Demonstrated experience in business process mapping, documenting new operating models and process re-engineering
  • Demonstrated experience implementing a Contract Lifecycle Management tool highly desirable
  • Excellent stakeholder management skills with the ability to influence successful business outcomes
  • Excellent ability to navigate through ambiguity and complex business environments to deliver outstanding business solutions

Your work at Australian Unity will be focused on helping others to thrive, and so we seek to create a work environment that supports you to thrive in your career. We operate with commercial principles and with a strong social purpose to create community value.

This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting business transformation journey working with stakeholders across a variety of business areas and domains. The position is a fixed term contract which will continue to June 2019.

Please include a cover letter detailing the HR related projects you have been involved in.

Join us and thrive!

\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Salesforce Solution Architect



At iSelect, we get that most people find insurance, utilities and personal finance boring. But we understand that it's really important to 'always get it right'. As Australia's 'Life Admin Store', we'll help you take care of the boring but important stuff. We provide Australians with the convenience of an online comparison and the benefit of telephone-based advice and sales across many product areas.

Our intuitive technology and highly trained staff help our customers to confidently compare and buy from hundreds of policies, plans and products. We operate in a growth-orientated, agile and progressive environment that fosters innovation and rewards success.


How you fit



The Salesforce Solution Architect builds a complete view of a solution for a project within a business domain (including, processes, information and information technology asset) from conception to implementation, ensuring that the solution meets the requirements and is aligned with the over-arching technology strategy and enterprise architecture guidelines/standards.\xa0


What you do


  • Develop and maintain target state solution architectures and roadmaps
  • Undertake high level research, horizon scanning and analysis to identify future ICT trends, and assess applicability
  • Maintain currency with industry best practice to ensure ICT solutions are fit for purpose
  • Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders to align strategies with business needs
  • Oversee the technical direction, development, and implementation of SFDC software solutions


What you need


  • A proven functional/technical professional with multiple full lifecycle SFDC implementations and at least 3+ years of experience working with SFDC
  • Direct experience with SFDC Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Service Cloud (application design, architecture and development using Salesforce.com), certified a MAJOR PLUS
  • Excellent understanding of current architectural design patterns, standards, technologies and techniques
  • Strong SFDC knowledge and Integration components for SFDC (for example, SFDC APIs, Apex controllers, Apex Web Services, Apex callout, outbound messaging, SFDC data loaders and Tools - e.g. Mulesoft)
  • Demonstrated in-depth knowledge of leading edge technologies and plans for the future of a technology and/or applications area
  • Strong knowledge of AGILE/SCRUM Processes


What is in it for you


  • A competitive salary plus yearly incentive program
  • Individual and career development to help you succeed
  • The opportunity to work with a well-known, Australian household brand
  • 3 'recharge' days per year (yes, in addition to your Annual Leave!)
  • Performance driven, casual environment and most importantly a fun, engaged and energised workforce!
  • A free coffee each day, a funky caf\xe9 and work space

884925618:
[

Leasing Executive

Company Name QIC Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 11 minutes ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

The opportunity


We currently have an 12 month maximum term, full time opportunity for an experienced retail Leasing Executive to join QIC’s Global Real Estateteam in Melbourne. At QIC, we adopt an investment style which is contemporary, sophisticated, disciplined and hands-on.


In this role you will bring your passion, enthusiasm and experience to this highly collaborative and successful team who have brought some of the best retail experiences toVictoria, Australia and abroad.


Working at our vibrant and established centres, where continued advancements and developments are happening, you will be required to provide a high-class service to our existing retail customersand leverage your existing networks to bring new clients to QIC within the aspirational and iconic retail platform.


You will be encouraged to bring new ideas to the team and cement transactions that help achieve our vision of a unique and multi-dimensional retail experience for our customers.


You will be well supported by one of the nation’s strongest tenancy design and delivery teams as well as a highly effective leasing admin team.


The ideal candidate


As a strong candidate for this role, you will have at least 5years’ experience within retail leasing, with previous asset project leasing experience and exceptional communication and negotiation skills. You will leverage your existing relationships to secure and service key retailer clients.


In addition, you will be able to demonstrate financial acumen and have a comprehensive knowledge and understanding of the relevant Retail Leases legislation. You will also have a current Real Estate Licence/Certificate of Registration or equivalent.


Why QIC & Global Real Estate


QIC is a global diversified alternative investment firm offering infrastructure, real estate, private equity, liquid strategies and multi-asset investments. It is one of the largest institutional investment managers in Australia, with A$86.1 billion (30 June 2018) in funds under management. QIC has over 1000 employees and serves more than 115 clients including governments, pension plans, sovereign wealth funds and insurers, spanning Australia, Europe, Asia, Middle East and the US. Headquartered in Brisbane, Australia, QIC also has offices in Sydney, Melbourne, New York, Los Angeles, Cleveland, Fort Lauderdale, San Francisco, London and Copenhagen.


At QIC our pursuit is to be an inclusive organisation, one in which every employee has a true voice. We want every employee to have a sense of belonging within QIC and this includes feeling like his or her difference is valued, whatever the difference. We want to build people leader capability to reduce unintended bias and ensure we are leveraging the uniqueness of all our people.


With approximately A$17.5 billion (30 June 2018) invested in Australian and international retail and commercial properties and a reputation for delivering predictable outcomes for clients over the long term, GRE’s team has specialist in-depth experience from deal origination and execution to asset management, leasing, marketing and development.


GRE originated in 1991 as part of QIC’s inception. Today, with professionals based in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Los Angeles and London, GRE is:



  • Consistently ranked as a top performing client-focused investment manager

  • A stable, long-standing, respected team with specialist depth of expertise.

  • Known for discipline, consistent returns and focus.


Apply now


To apply, please submit a cover letter and CV via our careers portal by3 October 2018.


Applications from Recruitment Agencies will not be considered.


Follow QIC on LinkedIn to receive the latest industry news and job updated athttps://www.linkedin.com/company/qic
